description: The `synthetic.change_requests` table represents requests for changes made within projects, capturing details such as the request's title, description, impact analysis, and approval information. It plays a central role in tracking change requests linked to specific projects, indicated by the foreign key relationship to the `project_id`. Key attributes include who requested and approved the change, the status of the request, and timestamps for creation and updates, allowing for detailed monitoring and auditing of change management processes.

columns.name: request_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each change request in the system, with sequential numbers assigned automatically to ensure each request has a distinct identifier.

columns.name: project_id
columns.description: Represents a unique identifier for a project associated with a change request. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: request_title
columns.description: This column represents the brief descriptions or titles of change requests, capturing key elements or objectives of each request in a concise format. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column contains descriptive narratives or summaries related to change requests, potentially capturing details, rationale, or context around the change. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: impact_analysis
columns.description: This column contains narrative descriptions or summaries of the potential consequences, considerations, and factors affected by a proposed change request. The purpose of these entries is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: requested_by
columns.description: This column likely identifies the individual or entity that initiated a change request, represented by a unique integer ID. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: request_date
columns.description: This column records the date when a change request was submitted, reflecting the time zone adjustments for Central Standard or Daylight Time. The dates are essential for tracking the timeline of change requests within the time context specific to the Central region.

columns.name: status
columns.description: This column indicates the current state of a change request within the system, reflecting whether it is active, pending, or inactive. The default state assigned to new change requests is 'submitted'.

columns.name: approved_by
columns.description: This column likely represents the identifiers for personnel who have approved change requests. The values suggest a link to a list of authorized approvers within the organization.

columns.name: approval_date
columns.description: The column represents the date on which a change request received formal approval. The date may not be present if the request is pending approval or if no approval is required.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a change request is initially created. The absence of a specified time zone indicates an adaptable timestamp based on system defaults.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a change request was last modified. The timestamp reflects Central Standard Time and updates to the current timestamp by default if no alternative is provided.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX change_requests_pkey ON synthetic.change_requests USING btree (request_id)
